title: Shasta
subtitle: Today I am in Gamcheon Cultural Village, where many of the Korean refugees fled during the war. These days it is still a residential district, but it's also a hub for local artists and encouraged as a tourist location. It's pretty neat. Today, it's also pretty cold. pic.twitter.com/pNdI5wrpLw

title: Alyssa Goch
subtitle: My friend Kenny was MIA for 4 years. Turns out he was on NGO rescue boats retrieving refugees seeking asylum from Libya. He documented some of the experiences with photos. Today is his exhibit opening at M Contemporary. Please take a moment for these brave people. pic.twitter.com/k62gThNR9w

title: Geoff Coffey
subtitle: I keep seeing arguments about American brutality towards refugee children that suggest I "imagine it was my own child" and all I can think of is this remarkable passage from Out of Oz by Gregory Maguire in which the Elephant Liir refuses to use his skills to help plan an attack. pic.twitter.com/SKOAI9lrGW

title: Sean Lawlor Nelson
subtitle: The Buddha teaches us to take the middle path. To accept refugees from war torn nations like Syria is a duty- that we share with the other nations of the world. We should accept some political refugees of course, but overall our immigration system should become more merit-based. pic.twitter.com/eU7KSinHwo

title: SAMS
subtitle: This week, our PSS team in #Jordan held a workshop on Early Marriage, addressing the implications & various mechanisms for decreasing its prevalence among female adolescents. 19 Syrian refugee women participated in this workshop.
